metadata.title: CASE 283/04: Investigation into Allegations of Theft and Corruption at Pristina Airport
metadata.primary_source: UN Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo

overview: Investigation Report on alleged corruption in handling, landing fees, and de-icing costs at Pristina Airport, including specific allegations regarding overcharging, unaccounted collections, and corrupt payments linked to landing slots.

applicable_laws.excerpt: Regulations promulgated by the Special Representative of the Secretary General and subsidiary instruments issued pursuant to those regulations; and The Law in force in Kosovo on 22 March 1989.
Staff members shall uphold the highest standards of efficiency, competence and integrity.

methodology.description: This investigation was conducted pursuant to Executive Decision No 2003/16 on the establishment of the Investigation Task Force. Interviews were conducted, and documents were obtained and analyzed from the Pristina Airport administration and Pillar IV.

background.context: The case stems from financial irregularities discovered in Pristina Airport's operation with implications involving UN staff and local employees.
timeline: 2001-01-01;2003-12-31: Maintenance by Public Enterprise Airport Pristina and KFOR
2002-06-30: Administration transition from Pillar II to KTA and Pillar IV
2004-04-01: Handover to civilian jurisdiction under ICAO regulations

allegations.description: Overcharging commercial flights for handling and landing fees.
allegations.findings: Calculations suggested fees collected matched official accounts, though the integrity of data is uncertain. Differences in costs were noted among airlines.

allegations.description: Failure to account for monies paid for handling and landing services.
allegations.findings: Receipt records incomplete, raising questions about accountability and consistent overcharging risks.

allegations.description: Requesting or receiving corrupt payments for allocating convenient landing slots.
allegations.findings: Lack of documented criteria for slot allocations suggests potential for manipulative practices.

key_findings: Multiple incidents of alleged corruption in airport operations.

findings: Three main allegations were investigated relating to operational corruption at Pristina Airport.

actions: Implement stricter audit and oversight mechanisms.
Review staff training on integrity and ethical conduct.
